verses.verse: Now Pashur <S%H6583><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Immer <S%H564><s%> the Kohen <S%H3548><s%>, who was also chief <S%H6496><s%> governor <S%H5057><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%>, heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> that Yirmeyah-yahu <S%H3414><s%> prophesied <S%H5012><s%> <S%H8738><s%> these things <S%H1697><s%>.

Then Pashur <S%H6583><s%> smote <S%H5221><s%> <S%H8686><s%> Yirmeyah-yahu <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%>, and put <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him in the stocks <S%H4115><s%> that were in the high <S%H5945><s%> gate <S%H8179><s%> of Binyamin <S%H1144><s%>, which was by the house <S%H1004><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%>.

And it came to pass on the morrow <S%H4283><s%>, that Pashur <S%H6583><s%> brought forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8686><s%> Yirmeyah-yahu <S%H3414><s%> out of the stocks <S%H4115><s%>. Then said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> Yirmeyah-yahu <S%H3414><s%> unto him, The YY <S%H3068><s%> hath not called <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8804><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> Pashur <S%H6583><s%>, but Magormissabib <S%H4036><s%>.

For thus saith <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the YY <S%H3068><s%>, Behold, I will make <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8802><s%> thee a terror <S%H4032><s%> to thyself, and to all thy friends <S%H157><s%> <S%H8802><s%>: and they shall fall <S%H5307><s%> <S%H8804><s%> by the sword <S%H2719><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, and thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall behold <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8802><s%> it: and I will give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> all Y'hudah <S%H3063><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and he shall carry them captive <S%H1540><s%> <S%H8689><s%> into Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and shall slay <S%H5221><s%> <S%H8689><s%> them with the sword <S%H2719><s%>.

Moreover I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> all the strength <S%H2633><s%> of this city <S%H5892><s%>, and all the labours <S%H3018><s%> thereof, and all the precious things <S%H3366><s%> thereof, and all the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Y'hudah <S%H3063><s%> will I give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, which shall spoil <S%H962><s%> <S%H8804><s%> them, and take <S%H3947><s%> <S%H8804><s%> them, and carry <S%H935><s%> <S%H8689><s%> them to Babylon <S%H894><s%>.

And thou, Pashur <S%H6583><s%>, and all that dwell <S%H3427><s%> <S%H8802><s%> in thine house <S%H1004><s%> shall go <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> into captivity <S%H7628><s%>: and thou shalt come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to Babylon <S%H894><s%>, and there thou shalt die <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and shalt be buried <S%H6912><s%> <S%H8735><s%> there, thou, and all thy friends <S%H157><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, to whom thou hast prophesied <S%H5012><s%> <S%H8738><s%> lies <S%H8267><s%>.

O YY <S%H3068><s%>, thou hast deceived <S%H6601><s%> <S%H8765><s%> me, and I was deceived <S%H6601><s%> <S%H8735><s%>: thou art stronger <S%H2388><s%> <S%H8804><s%> than I, and hast prevailed <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: I am in derision <S%H7814><s%> daily <S%H3117><s%>, every one mocketh <S%H3932><s%> <S%H8802><s%> me.

For since <S%H1767><s%> I spake <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%>, I cried out <S%H2199><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, I cried <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8799><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> and spoil <S%H7701><s%>; because the word <S%H1697><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%> was made a reproach <S%H2781><s%> unto me, and a derision <S%H7047><s%>, daily <S%H3117><s%>.

Then I said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, I will not make mention <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of him, nor speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%> any more in his name <S%H8034><s%>. But his word was in mine heart <S%H3820><s%> as a burning <S%H1197><s%> <S%H8802><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> shut up <S%H6113><s%> <S%H8803><s%> in my bones <S%H6106><s%>, and I was weary <S%H3811><s%> <S%H8738><s%> with forbearing <S%H3557><s%> <S%H8771><s%>, and I could <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not stay.

For I heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the defaming <S%H1681><s%> of many <S%H7227><s%>, fear <S%H4032><s%> on every side <S%H5439><s%>. Report <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8685><s%>, say they, and we will report <S%H5046><s%> <S%H8686><s%> it. All my familiars <S%H582><s%> <S%H7965><s%> watched <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8802><s%> for my halting <S%H6763><s%> <S%H8676><s%> <S%H6761><s%>, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed <S%H6601><s%> <S%H8792><s%>, and we shall prevail <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%> against him, and we shall take <S%H3947><s%> <S%H8799><s%> our revenge <S%H5360><s%> on him.

But the YY <S%H3068><s%> is with me as a mighty <S%H1368><s%> terrible one <S%H6184><s%>: therefore my persecutors <S%H7291><s%> <S%H8802><s%> shall stumble <S%H3782><s%> <S%H8735><s%>, and they shall not prevail <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: they shall be greatly <S%H3966><s%> ashamed <S%H954><s%> <S%H8804><s%>; for they shall not prosper <S%H7919><s%> <S%H8689><s%>: their everlasting <S%H5769><s%> confusion <S%H3639><s%> shall never be forgotten <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.

But, O YY <S%H3068><s%> TZva'ot <S%H6635><s%>, that triest <S%H974><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%>, and seest <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8802><s%> the reins <S%H3629><s%> and the heart <S%H3820><s%>, let me see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thy vengeance <S%H5360><s%> on them: for unto thee have I opened <S%H1540><s%> <S%H8765><s%> my cause <S%H7379><s%>.

Sing <S%H7891><s%> <S%H8798><s%> unto the YY <S%H3068><s%>, praise <S%H1984><s%> <S%H8761><s%> ye the YY <S%H3068><s%>: for he hath delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8689><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the poor <S%H34><s%> from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of evildoers <S%H7489><s%> <S%H8688><s%>.

Cursed <S%H779><s%> <S%H8803><s%> be the day <S%H3117><s%> wherein I was born <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8795><s%>: let not the day <S%H3117><s%> wherein my mother <S%H517><s%> bare <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me be blessed <S%H1288><s%> <S%H8803><s%>.

Cursed <S%H779><s%> <S%H8803><s%> be the man <S%H376><s%> who brought tidings <S%H1319><s%> <S%H8765><s%> to my father <S%H1><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, A man <S%H2145><s%> child <S%H1121><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8795><s%> unto thee; making him very <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8763><s%> glad <S%H8055><s%> <S%H8765><s%>.

And let that man <S%H376><s%> be as the cities <S%H5892><s%> which the YY <S%H3068><s%> overthrew <S%H2015><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and repented <S%H5162><s%> <S%H8738><s%> not: and let him hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the cry <S%H2201><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and the shouting <S%H8643><s%> at noontide <S%H6256><s%> <S%H6672><s%>;

Because he slew <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8790><s%> me not from the womb <S%H7358><s%>; or that my mother <S%H517><s%> might have been my grave <S%H6913><s%>, and her womb <S%H7358><s%> to be always <S%H5769><s%> great <S%H2030><s%> with me.

Wherefore came I forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8804><s%> out of the womb <S%H7358><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8800><s%> labour <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow <S%H3015><s%>, that my days <S%H3117><s%> should be consumed <S%H3615><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with shame <S%H1322><s%> ?
